metadata.name: Sweeping #83
metadata.description:
Sweeping is a piece in which I explore the uses of noise fields. Using them in the most cliche way possible, but trying to make something unique out of that.

What started out as an innocent weekend project grew out to be quite the piece, which is why I am publishing it here.



Sweeping uses the GPU of your machine for its shading, which means it won't run particularly well on mobile devices. My recommended way of viewing this piece is on a PC with a dedicated GPU.

---

- Double Click to open a User Interface
- In the UI, you can toggle the paper texture and export

---

Made with p5js + webgl by Wouter Missler, 2022.

metadata.name: Broken Symmetries #3/3 #144
metadata.description:
"I think a lot of us feel, when we look at the Dow Jones plunging, alienated - you do feel as if we're in the grip of some alien force that slipped human control."
Robert Harris

This piece is the third in a planed series of three intended as studies on composition.

It is built entirely on thi.ng/umbrella libraries and template:

https://github.com/thi-ng/fxhash-tpl

Keyboard shortcuts

- 1 : render @ original resolution
- 2 : render @ 2 x resolution
- 4 : render @ 4 x resolution
- x : download canvas as PNG @ current resolution
- s : download canvas as SVG @ current resolution; This can be used with a plotter.

metadata.name: Alley #86
metadata.description:
Staying in the little alley.
Narrow view, but enough.

Alley by Jinyao Lin (@jinyaolin)
This artwork was created using p5js.

metadata.name: fx(mash) #178
metadata.description:
fx(mash) is my humble contribution to celebrating #fxhashturnsone

This series is based on a simple algorithm - lines of a random length are drawn on a square grid until the grid is full.

I have added a variety of features based on some of my favorite fxhash projects and a few special guests.

This collection is intentionally diverse and disorderly, that's a nice way of saying I only had a short period of time following the release of Acequia. As a result, some of the outputs might be weird, messy, or even bordering on broken (if you get one of the latter please let me know and I'll reimburse you).

Despite being a bit rough around the edges, I hope fx(mash) reflects some measure of my love for the fxhash community. If you're feeling kind, then perhaps it even harks back to the experimental early days :)

The last year has been an incredible journey, thank you for letting me be a part of our story so far.

Controls (in live view):

- Press [s] to save the current image
- Press [g] to toggle grain
- Press [h] for a high-res output

Beta Controls (in live view, definitely not fully tested):

- Press [p] to start/pause animation
- Press [i] to slow down animation
- Press [o] to speed up animation

All primary sales go to Savepakistan.


Acknowledgements:

fx(mash) uses Gorilla Sun's grain implementation, a big thanks to him and meezwhite for a great article that is well worth supporting https://www.fxhash.xyz/article/all-about-that-grain

Thank you to the artists who created the following collections. Some were the source for palettes, others directly inspired traits, and some I thought would be fun to include as specific trait values.

metadata.name: Punktwelt #386
metadata.description:
Continuing on the theme of color perception in Farbteiler, Punktwelt is an exploration of color interaction, projection and perceived depth, and the aesthetics of simple Boolean operations on form.

Each shape is the result of a single block, a rectangular cuboid, subjected to a series of Boolean subtractions with other blocks, and rendered in parallel projection, oblique or axonometric, in the abstract landscape of the Punktwelt.

Some have horizons, some have banded or striped backgrounds. The unnatural drawing order and chromatic differences of the individual faces sometimes yields illusory or paradoxical visual geometries.

Press ’s’ to save a png. Press ’4’ to export a high resolution png. Press ’8’ to export a very high resolution png. Press ’e’ to export an SVG file (may take some time and produce large files).

Aspect ratio variations are 4:5, 5:4, 2:3, 3:2 and 1:1.

Built in Javascript with p5.js, p5.svg and csg.js.

metadata.name: Slumbers #277
metadata.description:
Generative abstract artwork that explores forms, shapes, coloring and brushwork.

Options:

- press 'f' to turn off paper-like texture (recommended for print on hi-quality paper)
- press 's' to save the PNG image of the current view
- press 1, 2, 3, or 4 to save hi-res PNG images

Colors and textures might differ slightly on some devices due to the heavy use of low alpha blending. Calibrated and tested on Firefox 107.0 & Chrome 107.0.5304.107 on Win10 x64 Intel machine.

Created using p5js.

@VolatileMoods, November, 2022.
tags: slumbers volatile moods abstract generative painting colors brushwork

metadata.name: GEN XYZ Das Occult #9504
metadata.description:
A 10k Generative Profile Pic collection
GEN XYZ Das Occult - by culla - @tamccullough

move over cryptopunks
there is a new group on the scene

100% code - not an image composition

A bunch of common palettes
A selection of rare palettes
And a smaller set of ultra rare palettes
However, rarity will be based on what combinations the code produces

The majority of tokens will not have a special trait
However your token might have one or even multiple special traits
But, be aware that only the last special trait added will be listed in the features

Even then, look closely, because not all aspects of the canvas are included in the features. Collectors should still look closely and choose what they like when buying on secondary.

Which team are you on? X or O?

follow culla on twitter for updates. Or maybe __acolyte__

If the non reserved tokens mint out quickly, Access List mints will have 24 hours to mint reserves assigned to those wallets

Thank you for supporting an emerging artist in the generative art space

Access List reserves were given to holders of the following PFP collections created by culla
2x for each Basqunk held
1x for each Inkspunk, TwoFourQunk, V0iD, DeeManz, Punkasso and CR0$$KULL
You would have needed to transfer the above tokens to your mint wallet at the time of the snapshot

share your tokens on social media with #genxyznft
Made with love by culla using p5.js

metadata.name: Henge #71
metadata.description:
Henge is an exploration of circular megalithic structures of the prehistoric age. It is a work of historical fiction where these stone assemblies, achieved through herculean efforts of stacking, aligning, and balancing immense chiseled rocks, are reimagined within an alternate universe of algorithmic possibility. Historically, henges share a few qualities that inspired this project. First, they are places of gathering within a loose collection of stones to organize ceremony or worship under celestial alignments. They are also monolithic in their materiality and employ the most elemental techniques of megalithic, or large stone, construction. These particular types of henges, known as cromlechs, are circular spaces fit with purpose and ritual and in this sense, serve as precedents to the great human edifices; charging landscapes with meaning and presence through geometry and order. Finally, henges are a collective language of place-making shared across a range of cultures and ages, from the Mesolithic and Neolithic eras and across territories from modern-day Morocco, Portugal, Brazil, Germany, Scandinavia, to the well-known Stonehenge in Great Britain.

This project is deeply inspired by the timeless and universal narrative created through the thoughtful and deliberate placement of large rocks in a circle. It seems that when confronted with marking a place and communing with nature, human beings like to make circles out of stones. Among all the symbols of place making, the circle is the original and still remains the most universal. Through the use of code to portray these imperfect structures, Henge animates the history of these circles in all their roughness and seemingly endless variation.


--------

Created by Aranda\Lasch @ArandaLasch
Creative collaboration with Tender @tender_art
November 2022

[Interaction instructions]
'left' + 'right' arrow keys to change view
'i' saves a 2048x2048 PNG

[Info]
p5.js
Henge is optimized for Chrome, runs slowly on Firefox (the longer the wait, the more stones and/or grass are being generated)
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0
10% of all primary and secondary proceeds donated directly to Girls Who Code

metadata.name: Colorful digital painting #2 #13
metadata.description:
Drawing using geometric forms and combining it with lines
And aged paper that makes the work style look old while being modern
A kind of postmodern work
It is as if you have built a new building on the foundation of an old building!

metadata.name: gradient descent #111
metadata.description:
Whether by choice or circumstance, we often find our lives thrust into uncertainty. We're resilient, though — we find patterns in the chaos, deciphering and unraveling it piece by piece until a new comfort emerges. `gradient descent` is my expression of that cyclical flow that comes to dominate our lives.

The piece starts with comfort, a smooth gradient chosen from a curated palette. As the animation runs, that gradient is mutated by a unique sequence of linear transformations - slice, skew or stride on an underlying grid - as it descends into uncertainty. After a time the animation will reverse, peeling back each transformation and returning to comfort before beginning anew.

The menu - which can be accessed with a double click or Escape - gives you extensive control of the experience. I'd encourage you to explore these settings — they transform the feel of the piece, allowing you to adapt it to match your environment or mood. Any setting that can be changed in the menu can also be provided as a URL parameter - there's a button in the menu to export them all.

Built with raw WebGL 1.0, optimised to run smoothly on most devices.

Best viewed in full screen on large format displays.

||| controls

[hold space] ⇝ speed up
[esc/2xclick] ⇝ toggle menu
[g] ⇝ toggle gallery mode
[p] ⇝ toggle pause
[s] ⇝ capture current frame
[a] ⇝ capture all keyframes
[8/9/0/-] ⇝ change viewport

||| settings

All settings are configurable via the interactive menu. Initial values can be set as url parameters by adding &[name]=[value] to the url.

loop [1|0, default 1]
|  ⇝  loop the animation
infinite [1|0, default 0]
|  ⇝  generate a new sequence after each descent, constantly evolving
gallery [1|0, default 0]
|  ⇝  display in gallery mode with keyframes
quality [#, default 1]
|  ⇝  additional dpr scaling - lower to improve animation smoothness
speed [#, default 1]
|  ⇝  multiplier for step animation speed
step-pause [#, default 0.35]
|  ⇝  seconds to pause between keyframe steps
start-pause [#, default 4]
|  ⇝  seconds to pause at the initial keyframe
end-pause [#, default 4]
|  ⇝  seconds to pause at the final keyframe

||| capture

Capture current frame saves the still immediately, while capture all keyframes saves each of the keyframes sequentially. Some browsers may require confirmation to save multiple stills. When triggered early, unrendered keyframes will be blank. All captures are impacted by the following settings.

capture-aspect [#, default 1]
|  ⇝  aspect ratio of the capture, as width/height
capture-size [#, default 2048]
|  ⇝  longest dimension of the captures to save, in pixels



NFT License, who? 2022
webgl engine based on lightgl by evanw
